transportAdvice: Panama City has a modern metro system and an extensive bus network that covers most tourist areas, making public transit a practical and affordable option. Taxis are widely available throughout the city, and the historic Casco Viejo district is best explored on foot.

weather.description: Dry season is well underway with sunny skies and little rain, making it one of the best months to visit.
Warm and dry with low humidity, ideal conditions for sightseeing and outdoor activities.
The hottest and driest month of the year, with strong sunshine and very little rainfall.
The dry season begins to transition as occasional afternoon showers start to appear toward month's end.
The rainy season begins in earnest with frequent afternoon and evening downpours.
Heavy and frequent rainfall throughout the month, with lush green landscapes as a result.
Continued heavy rains with overcast skies, though mornings are often clearer before afternoon storms.
One of the wettest months, with persistent rain and high humidity throughout the day.
Rain remains frequent and heavy, with the city experiencing some of its highest monthly rainfall totals.
Still firmly in the rainy season with regular downpours, though temperatures remain warm.
Rain begins to ease slightly toward the end of the month as the dry season approaches.
The transition back to the dry season brings fewer showers and more pleasant conditions for travel.
